an5.152:1.1: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:1.3: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. They think they know what they don’t know.
an5.152:1.4: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:2.1: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:2.3: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re wise, bright, and clever. They don’t think they know what they don’t know.
an5.152:2.4: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
